overview.heading: What is Vault?
overview.body: Secure, store, and tightly control access to tokens, passwords, certificates, encryption keys for protecting secrets, and other sensitive data using a UI, CLI, or HTTP API.

get_started.heading: Getting Started
get_started.body: Use Vault to securely store, access, and manage secrets and other sensitive data.

cards.heading: Vault Documentation
cards.body: Find user references for Vault concepts, server configuration, upgrade guides, release notes, FAQs, and more.

cards.heading: Vault CLI
cards.body: Vault features a command-line interface (CLI) that wraps common functionality and formats output.

cards.heading: Vault API
cards.body: This is the Vault HTTP API reference. Find the API endpoints and available parameters.

cards.heading: Vault Secrets Engine
cards.body: Secrets engines are pluggable components which store, generate, or encrypt sensitive data.

cards.heading: Database Secrets Engine
cards.body: Dynamically generates database credentials based on pre-configured roles.

cards.heading: Transit Secrets Engine
cards.body: Encrypt data in-transit to provide encryption as a service.

cards.heading: Transform Secrets Engine
cards.body: An Enterprise feature generates cryptographically secure tokens mapped to secure highly sensitive data.
